Detailed Description

Defines the data structures to keep track of memory resources of executing user programs (address spaces).

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Process *  p,

Constructor. Create an address space, initializing it with the program stored in the file "executable"

Address of the default first instruction to execute.

void AddrSpace::RestoreState (   ) 
 

Restore address space-specific info on a context switch: to be filled-in in the virtual memory assignment

void AddrSpace::SaveState (   ) 
 

Save address space-specific info on a context switch: to be filled-in in the virtual memory assignment

int AddrSpace::StackAllocate (   ) 
 

Allocate a new stack (will be changed in the virtual memory assignment)

Member Data Documentation

VoidFunctionPtr AddrSpace::codeStartAddress [private]
 

Code start address.

int AddrSpace::freePageId [private]
 

Number of the next virtual page allocated. Virtual addresses are simply allocated : an allocation will simply increment this address by the size of the allocated object
